*Before attempting these questions, it is highly recommended that you read [Guide: Multivariate implicit differentiation](../studyguides/multivariateimplicitdifferentiation.qmd).*

## Q1 {.unnumbered}

Decide whether the following equations represent explicit or implicit functions.

1.1. $\quad \displaystyle x^3 + y^3 - 6xy = 0$

1.2. $\quad \displaystyle y = 3x^2 + 2x - 5$

1.3. $\quad \displaystyle y = \dfrac{4x}{x-1}$

1.4. $\quad \displaystyle x^2 + y^2 - 9 = 0$

1.5. $\quad \displaystyle y = \sqrt{x^2 + 4}$

1.6. $\quad \displaystyle x^2 + y^2 - 25 = 0$

1.7. $\quad \displaystyle x + y = 4$

1.8. $\quad \displaystyle x^2 + y^2 + 2xy = 4$

1.9. $\quad \displaystyle x^2 - 3y = 7$

1.10. $\quad \displaystyle x^3 + 2xy + y^2 = 10$

## Q2 {.unnumbered}

Use the multivariate implicit differentiation rule to find $\dfrac{\mathrm{d}y}{\mathrm{d}x}$ for each equation of the form $w = f(x,y) = 0$, where $y$ is defined implicitly as a function of $x$.

2.1. $\quad \displaystyle x^2+y^2-25=0$

2.2. $\quad \displaystyle x^3y+y^3-7=0$

2.3. $\quad \displaystyle x^2-\dfrac{3y+2}{y-1}=0$

2.4. $\quad \displaystyle \sin(xy)+x=y$

2.5. $\quad \displaystyle x \mathrm{e}^{y} + y^2 = 4$

2.6. $\quad \displaystyle x^2y-3xy^2+5=0$

2.7. $\quad \displaystyle \ln(x)+\ln(y)=1$

2.8. $\quad \displaystyle \tan^{-1}\left( \dfrac{y}{x} \right) - x^2 = 0$

2.9. $\quad \displaystyle y^3+\cos(xy) = x$

2.10. $\quad \displaystyle x \sin(y) + y \cos(x) = 0$

2.11. $\quad \displaystyle x^2 + 2xy + y^2 - 1 = 0$

2.12. $\quad \displaystyle \mathrm{e}^{xy} + x - y = 0$

2.13. $\quad \displaystyle x^3 + y^3 - 3xy - 7=0$

2.14. $\quad \displaystyle \sqrt{x}+y^2-3=0$

2.15. $\quad \displaystyle \dfrac{x+y}{x-y} - \ln(x) = 0$

## Q3 {.unnumbered}

Use the multivariate implicit differentiation rule to find $\dfrac{\partial z}{\partial x}$ and $\dfrac{\partial z}{\partial y}$ for each equation of the form $w = f(x,y,z) = 0$, where $z$ is defined implicitly as a function of $x$ and $y$.

3.1. $\quad \displaystyle x^2+y^2+z^2=1$

3.2. $\quad \displaystyle 4x^2+3y^2z^2-5x^2y+2z^3-7=0$

3.3. $\quad \displaystyle xyz=1$

3.4. $\quad \displaystyle \mathrm{e}^{xz}+y-z=0$

3.5. $\quad \displaystyle \sin(xz)+\cos(yz)-2=0$

3.6. $\quad \displaystyle \ln(x)+\ln(y)+\ln(z)-1=0$

3.7. $\quad \displaystyle x^3+y^3+z^3-3xyz=0$

3.8. $\quad \displaystyle x^2z+y^2z+\sqrt{z}-4=0$

3.9. $\quad \displaystyle \mathrm{e}^{x}+y^2z-\tan^{-1}(z)=0$

3.10. $\quad \displaystyle \ln(xz)+xy-z=0$

3.11. $\quad \displaystyle x\mathrm{e}^{yz}+y\mathrm{e}^{xz}-5=0$

3.12. $\quad \displaystyle \sin(x)\cos(z)+yz^2-1=0$

3.13. $\quad \displaystyle x^2+y\mathrm{e}^{z}+z=0$

3.14. $\quad \displaystyle \dfrac{x+y}{z} + \ln(z)-3=0$

3.15. $\quad \displaystyle \sqrt{xyz}+x-y-z=0$
